column5: I‚Äôve seen a lot of people having success with high protein diets or counting macros, I‚Äôve yet to try it myself as I just don‚Äôt have the time to track it.
I am starving most of the time but I know I eat less than 12/1300 calories and the weight maintains, but doesn‚Äôt go. It‚Äôs so frustrating.

The problem I have is being asymptomatic and giving it to my partner. Like everyone who has shared their story of having it doesn‚Äôt get the high temperature/continuous cough and most start with a slight runny nose which I ALWAYS have so I‚Äôm shitting myself

I started a new job, my first full time job, and recently diagnosed with fibromyalgia.

On top of years of trauma I‚Äôm still going through therapy for and a partner at risk, who I don‚Äôt get to see cause of night shift, this virus shows up.

During the day I can be distracted to a point but as soon as I get back I break. I just want to crawl in a hole. There‚Äôs so much going on my head can‚Äôt handle it.

And I‚Äôve done well in my recovery until this popped up. You‚Äôre not alone OP.
I get it for mental health but not anything else. Hoping I can get it bumped up cause it‚Äôs not a lot, but I had to fight for it just for mental health. If they can‚Äôt see it it‚Äôs not there :/
I‚Äôm on year 7 and got diagnosed only recently. I guess all the years of ‚Äúyou‚Äôre too young‚Äù I‚Äôve put myself into denial.

Your thyroid can most definitely changed. Mine got lower over the years and it‚Äôs finally stable. 

It‚Äôs definitely not in your head but that‚Äôs the issue with hidden illness. I have fibromyalgia along with ptsd and a lot of the advice is things like ‚Äúoh you just need to exercise‚Äù or ‚Äújust take painkillers and get over it‚Äù

Like nooooooooo.

I‚Äôd go back and get checked for thyroid and any deficiencies.

It‚Äôs really the worst! I first started getting symptoms at around 17/18, and was constantly fobbed off as I was ‚Äútoo young‚Äù to have it. I had to give up so many hobbies and sports. 

I recently went to a new doctor, I actually went on to ask about being checked for ME and she started poking me in certain places, asked what my other symptoms were and said it sounded like fibro, so got sent for tests to rule everything out and she diagnosed me the next time I seen her.

Whether I get referred to rheumatology is another thing, it took 3 years just to get seen about my migraines. 

It‚Äôs finding the right doctor who will listen. So many dont but don‚Äôt give up yet. I wish you all the best in finding one.

I joined a kink group because I was told it would help my trauma.

I too went through childhood sexual abuse along with a sexually abusive partner.

I thought, by joining the group, I‚Äôd be in control of sex for once. I‚Äôd get to say what does and doesn‚Äôt happen. I tried a lot of things and thought I finally got to grips with people not using me.

The thing is, people were using me and I didn‚Äôt see it. I let the fantasy of people beating me and breaking my boundaries as ‚Äúbut I let them do it, I chose to try this‚Äù and all it did was traumatise my inner child more.
This was more so when I fell into the DDLG community, and people got off to me regressing from my trauma.

But I loved the attention. Even bad attention is good when you are deprived that at an early age.

It‚Äôs not your fault. I don‚Äôt know what to say, I‚Äôm still going through therapy for a lot of the shit I was put through. 

It does get better. It‚Äôs a lot of work, and soothing your inner child and being a good parent to them. 

It‚Äôs hard work but it pays off, I hope you‚Äôre in a better place.

I second counting macros or having a calorie deficit. There‚Äôs a group on Facebook that‚Äôs really good, I have hypo and fibromyalgia so can‚Äôt move so much, and with the medication I‚Äôm on it‚Äôs ridiculous to lose weight. It can be done, it‚Äôs just finding what‚Äôs right for you!

Regardless of what you do, it‚Äôs going to require some form of communication with others.

I had really bad social anxiety to the point where if someone said hello to me I‚Äôd break down in tears and go straight into a panic attack.

How did I combat this? 

Forced myself into going out. Working with animals helped a lot, but I started volunteering and it really took me out of my shell. 

I also went (and still go through) therapy for the traumatic events. Because I know the worst can happen and has happened multiple times that really fucked up my ability to just go out and be with people, knowing the sort of fuckery they can cause.

It does get better, start small and work up. You will have to deal with people in anything you do. I suggest therapy if you haven‚Äôt already or even medication because that helped me as well.

The thing is, I can do it and do it regularly. I can talk to my 10 year old self like this because that‚Äôs what has been ingrained in me from a very young age by parents. 
I wish it was different. But it‚Äôs a very good thing for those that can see the difference.
I keep getting the ‚Äúcut dairy‚Äù out but dairy doesn‚Äôt affect my. Gluten does however and I know it affects a lot of others I know.

Have only started it about 2 weeks ago. 
I‚Äôve been told a lot of side effects happen, so far the only thing I‚Äôve noticed is a bit of drowsiness (amplified by my thyroid meds) not being able to form sentences (over text after taking) and mouth has been a bit dry. Also been getting while lucid dreams, although that could be part of my other meds as well.

I know some people swear by it but for the most part, people seem to not like it. Or anyone I‚Äôve come in contact anyway.

Suppressing your memories works for a while, but until you actually start your recovery they will keep coming up.

It‚Äôs like a car warning light. It‚Äôs there, and you can maybe push it for another few miles but you‚Äôll eventually have to get it looked at.

You don‚Äôt stop thinking about it, but, each time you do it gets less and less triggering. You get less ‚Äúactivated‚Äù and you just get better at taking that power back.

It‚Äôs a hard task to do on your own so I suggest you look into a therapist who specialises in trauma so they can help you rewire and explain the process.

I mean, I still break down over the thoughts, but it doesn‚Äôt last as long. I still sometimes put my head down when I see my abuser, but not all the time. Fuck, I‚Äôve even smiled at his ma. I wave at my ma (who was abusive) cause I know it makes them annoyed, but that‚Äôs because I‚Äôm putting their shit back on them, it‚Äôs not mine to deal with.

It takes time, effort and allowing yourself to be angry at those people. It‚Äôs not linear, but definitely worth the effort.

So far we only have gloves (volunteers) and as far as I‚Äôm aware so does the paramedics but that would change if there are more cases being presented. 

But then again, patients lie about symptoms so for the moment we are only told to follow obvious infection control (gloves, hand washing, cleaning equipment) and if there is a suspected case to call control and follow their guidelines.
Mine usually checks bloods every 6 months. However I have other health conditions anyway that require me to come in every 1/2/3 months so they just check the thyroid then and there.

Just follow the protocols put in place by your trust. The government etc. Has posted on what first responders/volunteers should do should they come in contact but your trust will have its own infection control policies.

If things are changing I would go back to the doctor to make sure your levels haven‚Äôt changed. Over the years I‚Äôve gradually had to increase my medication and it‚Äôs settled for now but unsure how long that will last.

I never thought it as bad until it started getting worse and more frequent, and things getting infected.

It‚Äôs bad because it‚Äôs not healthy. Yes you have full control of your body and you can choose what you want, however, you must think very low of your body to put it through constant pain. All it takes is that one time and there‚Äôs no going back. Just like how drug users just have ‚Äúone more shot‚Äù or alcoholics have ‚Äúone more glass‚Äù. 

After years of doing it I‚Äôm honestly ashamed I put my body through so much physical torment when it was having a hard enough time dealing emotionally. I appreciate how connected it was but when I started seeing my worth, and my value I started to cut less and less and I‚Äôve been like a year clean now. 

That‚Äôs just my view on it.

Texture is what always an issue for me, also taste in vegetables.

So what I do for fruit is I blend it into a smoothie, add things like low fat yoghurt, honey to sweeten or cinnamon etc.

For vegetables, I like to make soup, and season well for taste.

Things like carrots are easy peasy to eat, you can add (low fat) dips, eat veg with chicken to hide the taste.

Just about exploring different things to find what suits. It takes time as well, it took me forever to integrate more veg and stuff but it‚Äôs about flavouring it.

I view things very black and white. You‚Äôre either good or bad. It‚Äôs how I keep myself safe but it‚Äôs not great in the long run, because I could be punishing myself for a one off mistake.

You don‚Äôt know the circumstances though. 

For example - my dog doesn‚Äôt like you touching her tail and would growl when we first got her: turned out the person who had her before had it broken.

Now she trusts us, we can touch it. This could be a new dog that isn‚Äôt used to things, and that takes time. The owner set this up for failure. It isn‚Äôt the dogs fault.

You‚Äôd be surprised on some of the methods used to train elephants, a lot are brutal and sadistic but elephants don‚Äôt fight back. They break their spirit. Yes, they could easily crush someone however, they don‚Äôt.

Some dogs are more tolerant than others. But people forget they are animals. They react, as animals would do in any situation. My two are both spaniels. They both have very different tolerances and personalities.

It‚Äôs also worth taking into consideration the background this dog had. Maybe the people let the child disrupt it instead of letting it sleep, maybe it had issues before that were not addressed. It‚Äôs not the dogs fault. 

My dog is very iffy about someone touching her tail because her previous owner tried to break it. So her reaction is understandable, but she doesn‚Äôt lash out cause she knows the people she trusts won‚Äôt do that.

It‚Äôs very circumstantial but the people who recorded this knew what would happen. This is how children get bitten and dogs put down.
